Key Arguments: The bill undermines freedom of speech by creating a hierarchy of citizens, privileging politicians, journalists, and educators over regular citizens.
Excessive fines will lead to overly restrictive digital platforms, harming free speech.
Determining truth is complex and subjective, as scientific consensus can change over time.
The bill contradicts efforts to promote competition and innovation in the digital market.
The legislation could stifle diverse viewpoints and democratic discourse.
The bill poses a threat to freedom of thought, conscience, and religious beliefs.
Notable Quotes: The existence of this bill sends a clear message that the government does not respect the freedom of speech of Australian citizens.
Accurately judging what is true or untrue is an impossible task.
The proposed legislation poses a direct threat to individuals' freedom of thought, conscience, and religious beliefs.
